unit_learning_outcomes.description: To apply the Professional Behaviour and Conduct Code of Audiology Students (as stated in the Guidelines of Clinical Practice).
To generate and perform foundation skills in the interpretation and integration of audiological information.
To identify and use aspects of professional communication, particularly those pertaining to the client interview.
To prepare for clinical placements and identify a variety of cases.

To develop and apply knowledge and practical skills in basic audiological assessment including skills in basic adult diagnostic audiological appointments (pure tone audiometry, acoustic immittance measurement and speech testing).
To demonstrate the principles of ethics in the Audiological profession.

assessments.description: placement goals, evaluation and reflection. Students are required to prepare 2 pages of learning goals, complete a placement evaluation and also a one page reflective writing piece
students need to demonstrate ability to perform basic skills
Online clinical assessments to assure clinical learning.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 1, Special circumstances

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit is offered on a pass/fail basis. This unit aims to provide students with the knowledge and practical skills in basic adult audiological assessment, assist students' interpretation and integration of audiological information and provide students with an opportunity to develop a professional approach to audiological casework. Students are provided with an overview of the profession of audiology through initial observation in clinical environments as well as the opportunity to practice audiometric assessment on simulations and real clients. Students are also introduced to the principles of ethics. At the end of this unit, students are expected to be competent in pure tone audiometry, acoustic immittance assessment and speech recognition testing in adults.
data.title: Clinical Practicum I
